question: I've got a folder i pulled over from my ntfs drive, and it's all read only. What's the easiest way to set these permissions for Owner Write?
did you do this as root or as a regular user?
I ran this in the terminal from my Home directory "chmod -R o+w FAIA/" and the permissions didn't change. FAIA being the folder in my Home directory where all the subfiles and folders are
then it won't cause much of a problem. You will only have modified files that were owned by the user. User-owned files that are write-protected are quite rare.
revert the damage from my mistake by doing 'chmod -R o-w FAIA/'
